column4: hello can repartition a 120GB drive and format it fat32 with ubuntu and please tell me how
- you sure about FAT32? These days, you would be happy with NTFS in most cases, too.
well how do i defrag NTFS with ubuntu?

- uhm. You wouldnt usually defrag. Maybe with windows or even some Linux tool, but I dont know of any. Most people, I know, just copy the stuff to another partition/tape and then copy it back - e voila - defragged.
